visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts timeline chart with the title 'Timeline of Space Exploration'. The chart should display significant events in space exploration, including the first dogs in space, the launch of Sputnik 1, the first human spaceflight, and the first human on the Moon. The chart should have custom styling for labels, axes, and titles, with specific colors and font sizes. The chart should also include a subtitle with a link to the source of the information. Additional configurations should include inverted axes and hidden x and y axes.

data.name: First dogs
data.label: 1951: First dogs in space
data.description: 22 July 1951 First dogs in space (Dezik and Tsygan)

data.name: Sputnik 1
data.label: 1957: First artificial satellite
data.description: 4 October 1957 First artificial satellite. First signals from space.

data.name: First human spaceflight
data.label: 1961: First human spaceflight (Yuri Gagarin)
data.description: First human spaceflight (Yuri Gagarin), and the first human-crewed orbital flight

data.name: First human on the Moon
data.label: 1969: First human on the Moon
data.description: First human on the Moon, and first space launch from a celestial body other than the Earth. First sample return from the Moon

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration object is designed to render a timeline chart that visualizes key events in the history of space exploration. The chart is titled 'Timeline of Space Exploration' and includes a subtitle with a link to the source of the information. The chart type is set to 'timeline', and the axes are inverted to provide a vertical timeline effect. The x and y axes are hidden to focus on the timeline events. The data series includes four significant events, each with a name, label, and description. Custom colors are applied to the events, and the legend is disabled to simplify the visualization. The chart is styled with specific colors and font sizes for the title and subtitle, enhancing readability and visual appeal.
